channel.title: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?
channel.description:
Title says it all.
Any thoughts?

item.title: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Reading ini files is slow in java, especially the way it’s set up. Php would most likely be slow as well, especially for things such as high scores.

On the other hand, databases are quick, and easy to manage, but require more overhead. When getting a lot of data that requires conditional selection (such as high scores, getting player data, ect), you will definitely be outperformed by a database.

As for why people use EasyRSC over RSCD, the only reason I would use the former would be if I didn’t know how to set up a database, and didn’t feel like learning.

Read full topic
item.source: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?

item.title: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

adu:

Mysql is just more organized and easy to find stuff from. You won’t find that big of difference in write/read speed too.

“Select * from players where attack_exp > 1000”

Do that with ini based files when you have 10k players.

Read full topic

item.title: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

easyrsc was basically made for people who want to get started in development, wasn’t to my understanding released to actually make grade A servers or be used for any other comparability. Personally prefer RSCD.

item.title: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?
item.dc:creator: @kakur007 kakur007
item.description:
@kakur007 wrote:

EasyRsc is really easy to use for beginners thats why they use it. There is alot more troubles with RSCD. I have seen that there is alot leaks and bugs in RSCD forums so basicly everyone can hack it. I have never tryed myself but i have seen it on many servers

Read full topic

item.title: Which one is more stable - MySQL DB(RSCD) or *.ini based(EasyRSC)?
item.dc:creator: @inTouch inTouch
item.description:
@inTouch wrote:

I have enough experience with MySQL but I am still not sure why people use EasyRSC rather than RSCD’s SQL-db.

Waiting for more thoughts.
